alert.note: Alert for Claiborne; Hancock (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 26 at 12:24AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Claiborne and Hancock. Portions of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Lee. * WHEN...Until 415 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 123 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen during the past hour. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area during the next hour or two. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sneedville, Jonesville, Pennington Gap, Rose Hill, Evanston, Kyles Ford, Ewing and Howard Quarter. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
